title: Alt Tab on Windows 10
author: cusco
body_snippet:
<!-- Bug -->
|||
|--:|---|
|Operating system | Windows 10 Pro x64 |
|mRemoteNG version| 1.75 hotfix 1 (2017-03-06)|

Hello all. I've searched on the internet and I find many people reporting this issue. On foruns and Jira, but I didn't find the issue here. 
Also reports I found are old.

Basically, when i have mRemoteNG opened with at least a putty session, I can't cycle correctly thorough windows applications with alt tab.

- Have mRemoteNG focused
- Alt + Tab to another App -> stay...

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: Thanks for adding your report here. Yea, there are a number of very annoying focus-related issues in the application. I don't believe we have these issues scheduled yet, but they are on our mind.

comments.author: kmscode
comments.snippet: @cusco Please upvote / track this problem via #290

comments.author: wakinowen
comments.snippet:
I found out that check on the option"Allow only a single instance" would surprisingly fix this issue!

Tools->Options->Startup/Exit->Allos only a single instance of application

comments.author: charannaik
comments.snippet: Yes, it indeed works !! Thanks @wakinowen

comments.author: Tinostarn
comments.snippet: Worked for me too @wakinowen

comments.author: fred070
comments.snippet: @wakinowen, this works for me! :)

comments.author: fpelaezt
comments.snippet: It works

comments.author: cusco
romangit
comments.snippet: The problem still exist and I agree with @cusco, workaround doesn't work

comments.author: Idanatcox
comments.snippet: the workaround by @wakinowen doesn't resolve the issue in my setup - win10 1.75.7012.16814

comments.author: cawoodm
comments.snippet: Is there any way to disable Alt+Tab so that it no longer cycles through remote windows but only local windows. This is how RoyalTS works: you use Alt+PgUp/Down to cycle through remote windows.

comments.author: aswzen
comments.snippet:
it works on Win 10 64 bit..  
===UPDATE===
Only works at first time, after you exit the app and open again the problem happened again, you need to  recheck and check again the "Allow only a single instance of application"

comments.author: howdoyoudoooo
comments.snippet:
> 
> 
> @wakinowen it does not seem to work for me!
> 
> Activate the option, exit remote-ng, open remote-ng and 2 putty sessions. Same issue.
> Alt tab will not cycle correctly :(

in putty configuration, Window-->behaviour , check on "Ensure window is always on top"
it works for me.

comments.author: cusco
comments.snippet:
> For quick fix, i just attach the remoteNg app to cmder app
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1474916/63072189-a8af6f00-bf4c-11e9-942d-c8e4cffcc6ef.png) ..and the alt+tab issue gone

Didn't try it yet, nor do I know cmder, but I can imagine it works. I will probably tap into this myself

comments.author: pedroeloy
comments.snippet:
Unfortunately with cmder it does not work for me.

When Alt-Tabing between writing on Puttyng (inside mremoteng) and notepad the first alt-tab goes back to cmder instead of notepad. Only the second alt-tab switches to notepad.

comments.author: loxiagit
comments.snippet:
Weird ALT-TAB behavior indeed.

Looks like the row with apps, which is shown after pressing ALT-TAB, isn't updated correctly after selecting mRemoteNG. The program is selected okay, the row afterwards isn't updated: mRemoteNG stays in its previous position (2nd, 3rd, whatever). The focus in the row (white border) is correct on the previous app but it is still in front.

After selecting mRemote for the 2nd time the row get updated correctly and mRemoteNG shows up in front and the previous app...

comments.author: cawoodm
comments.snippet: I'm now in the situation that Alt+Tab works remotely on some servers and Alt+PgUp works on others. This is crazy.

comments.author: pedroeloy
aswzen
comments.snippet:
This issue has been reported since 6 more years ago and having no actual update fix since, the only work around for me in windows 10 was by putting mRemoteNG application to the first order in bottom taskbar, then when i want to switch to mRemoteNG i just press **Win + 1**
Good luck

comments.author: jogyo
comments.snippet: Is this still not fixed in April 2020? It is such an annoying issue that I'm sure other people than me are considering switching to alternatives. Other than this issue mRemoteNG is fantastic.

comments.author: lukecamilo
comments.snippet:
Still happening, and after applying this [workaround](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/520#issuecomment-355487738) it happens SOMETIMES.  
Awfully weird and inconsistent

comments.author: mbuc
comments.snippet: This is still happening for me.  Version 1.76.20.24615

comments.author: konstantin83
comments.snippet:
1. Very annoying. Is there any other app, that doesn't have this issue? I always have to use my mouse just to switch back to mRemoteNG from my PHPstom or ant other window.
2. ALSO if I click on text region of mRemoteNG, the cursor itself sets to cli string, and I even can type something, WHILE WINDOW ITSELF IS NOT FOCUSED. This is sooo strange behaviour...

comments.author: therightstuff
comments.snippet: How is this still a thing so many years later ? It's an otherwise excellent application, but this is extremely annoying behaviour.

comments.author: royujjal
comments.snippet:
I have 1.76.20 version with latest till now, but still not working. Please fix this issue, else I had to use windows remote desktop to skip that I am using this app.

Updating my old commit: to reply how it is working.
Just you need to go to "Config" and under config find the "Redirect" under that select "Key Combination" as Yes. You are done and working properly. Attaching the image which is also showing the description how to send Alt+TAB to remote.
![image](https://user-images.githubuserc...

comments.author: NothingCtrl
comments.snippet:
(Tested) You can try this way:

* in mRemoteNG, menu Tools->Options->Startup/Exit->_Allow only a single instance of application..._ -> restart mRemoteNG
* in **cmder** -> menu -> Attach to -> select mRemoteNG

in attach mode, some menu to mRemoteNG is not display properly, also lagging when resize cmder windows if current tab is mRemoteNG.

comments.author: Kongolan
comments.snippet:

This is a killer for me as well. It hurts my productivity and is annoying on top, which makes me leave this app for now.

comments.author: royujjal

comments.author: ukanuk
comments.snippet: This is broken for me too, when Redirect Key Combinations is active, I still expect CTRL+ALT+HOME to let me un-trap the focus and alt+tab to other applications. Also see #1169 and https://superuser.com/a/505533/618270

comments.author: northbear
comments.snippet:
It looks like it happens because of using PuTTy as a backend. My quick research shows that the issue is encountered if before switching from mRemoteNG to another application the focus stays inside a terminal (that actually a PuTTy application). If before the switching make a click by mouse on any part of mRemoteNG outside the terminal screen (obviously, to move the focus from PuTTy backend to mRemoteNG itself) the switching back to mRemoteNG by ALT-TAB works great. 
I hope it helps to fix the i...

comments.author: roberticomold
comments.snippet: If you just had under 'Send Special Keys' 'Ctrl' and 'Alt' that would help immensely.

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet: "%MSG%"

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.

notes: Manual triage: Duplicate of general Alt-Tab/focus issues in RDP - Windows 10 focus stealing is an OS-level behavior, not mRemoteNG-specific. Related to #2735 (RDP SmartSize focus loss).
